an1.219-234:1.1: “The foremost of my monk disciples who are very learned is Ānanda.
an1.219-234:2.1: … with a good memory is Ānanda.
an1.219-234:3.1: … with an extensive range is Ānanda.
an1.219-234:5.1: … as a personal attendant is Ānanda.
an1.219-234:6.1: … with a large congregation is Uruvelakassapa.
an1.219-234:7.1: … who inspire lay families is Kāḷudāyī.
an1.219-234:9.1: … who recollect past lives is Sobhita.
an1.219-234:10.1: … who have memorized the texts on monastic training is Upāli.
an1.219-234:11.1: … who advise the nuns is Nandaka.
an1.219-234:12.1: … who guard the sense doors is Nanda.
an1.219-234:13.1: … who advise the monks is Mahākappina.
an1.219-234:14.1: … who are skilled in the fire element is Sāgata.
an1.219-234:15.1: … who inspire eloquent teachings is Rādha.
an1.219-234:16.1: … who wear coarse robes is Mogharāja.”
